reviews.review: If you haven't played this game, play it. Seriously, buy it and play it then continue with portal 2. Trust me. Just stop looking through the comments right now coz everyone will be saying the same thing: GET THE GAME AND PLAY IT!
這款遊戲真的很不錯玩,尤其是它的FPS式解謎,更是增加了一股新鮮感,不過缺點就是主線劇情實在太短,幾乎一個下午就能玩完了,而且實驗室也只有19間,跟二代比起來真的非常少

Если же вам будет мало основных 19 камер, то в игре есть усложненные камеры, будет над чем попотеть.
Советую для прохождения всем без исключения!

Ein wirklich geniales Spiel. Es macht richtig viel Spaß diese Physikrätssel zu lösen. Manche Rätsel zu lösen ist gar nicht so einfach, weil man z.B. auch gutes Timing braucht. Hat man das Spiel durch gibt es auch noch einige Herausforderungen       ( kürzeste Zeit, die wenigsten Schritte, die wenigsten Portale ) zur Lösung eines Levels. Besonders lustig ist dabei Glados     ( die Stimme aus dem Off ),  die wie sich im Laufe des Spieles herausstellt unsere Gegenspielerin ist und z.B. unser Handeln mit Sarkasmus und Ironie kommentiert. SPIELT DIESES SPIEL...( Denn zur Belohnung gibt es einen Kuchen )

Portal.
My favorite video game of all time.
Now I only have about 20 hours in this game, whereas I have hundreds of hours in other games like tf2 and cs go. And it should be obvious why; Portal is just a single player game, and a short one at that. But when it comes to what video game has blown me away with its sheer brilliance the most, Portal still has no equal. The genius that went into this little game that was supposed to be a side title is unbelievable. Best soundtrack I've ever heard in a game, too. This was the first Valve game I ever played, and while I have since gone on to play just about every other major Valve game (except Dota 2) extensively, no game holds the place in my heart that this one has, and always will.

I don't think I will ever again see a game that blows me away quite like Portal.
This is a great feat of game design. For the people who have already played, this game is 99% tutorial. Not many games can pull that off and make it fun and enjoyable.
no gamer would hate this amazing masterpiece !

This was a very fun game. I enjoyed playing it and is a definate must have.

The one thing that I have to complain about is the campaign length. I only got 2 to 3 hours out of it which was really disappointing considering how much I enjoyed playing this game. Definately play this one before you play the second one if you wish to buy it. It just makes the story more easily understood even though you don't really need to have played the first one in order to enjoy the second.
This game is absolutely amazing.  Very fun chambers and a very twisted and intriguing ending, easily worth the 10 :D

This game is amazing, realy good story, full of humour. The puzzles graudully get harder as you progress through the game giving you time to get used to how it all works. None of the puzzles are hard enough to let you give up- but still require a some seriouse thinking-especialy near the end. The games has great graphics and works realy smoothly. The story dosen't realy take long to complete ( it took me about 4 hours) but there are a lot of bonus maps to complete as well as the actull game 8/10

Despite not having an obvious storyline, Portal keeps you motivated from start to finish. Full of interesting, if somewhat two dimensional, characters the game moves right along as you attempt to free yourself from a testing facility. Portal contains a variety of puzzles so that when you find your comfort zone on one challenge you're faced with another. Overall this game is fantastic for those who enjoy beautifully made puzzle games.

<<THE PORTAL QUIZ>>
1. Do you like cheap games?
2. Do you like puzzles?
3. Do you like a great time killer?
4. Do you like Valve?
5. Do you like Steam?
6. Do you like video games at all?

If you answered "yes" to any of those questions, then Portal is the game for you!

The cake is a lie.

Portal is a puzzle game created by Valve in 2007. In this game, you play as Chell, a woman trapped in the Aperture Science enrichment center with only GLaDOS, an  Android incharge of the facility, for company. GLaDOs gives Chell the Aperture Science handheld portal device (better known as the Portal Gun) to run some tests with.

Each level comes in the form of a test chamber. You must use the Portal Gun and other objects around you to open up the exit door and move onto the next. There are about 17 main story test chambers and some bonus challnge maps for when you're done with that. 

The Portal Gun can be used to put Portals on walls, floors and ceilings.  You can go through the portals so you dont have to walk long distances or fall into deadly toxic pools. You can also transport items through the portals and get them where they need them to be.

In terms of Lore, Portal has plenty of it (Well, a fairly good lore, it's not as much as FNaF, but something like it) As you go throughout the enrichment center, you can find secret rooms with drawings and writing on the walls. These are speculated to be from a guy called Dougg Ratman, the test subject before you. The walls will have creepy things written on them like:
"THE CAKE IS A LIE"
"SHE IS WATCHING"

No review is complete without some cons, and I'll show you those now:
CON #1: Too many time based challenges. Where you have to rush from one place ot another with a clock ticking in the background. It's stressful, especially in the final boss fight.
CON #2:A bit short. I personally dont mind short games. I like 'em quite alot. But for people looking for a longer experience, I reccomend you play the sequel, Portal 2, instead.
CON #3: Too many sections where you're just standing around waiting for something to happen.

Overall, Portal is a mostly enjoyable puzzle game with unique physics, interesting characters and mysterious lore. I reccomend it to anyone who likes puzzle games or people looking for a just generally challenging experience. Due to its length, I'd also reccomend Portal to speedrunners, because with plenty of different ways to escape Aperture Science and short length, it's right up your street.

P.S. You get cake at the end. ;-)

Pros:
- Semi challenging puzzles
- Great atmosphere (creates the story)

Cons:
- Very short and subtle story

玩了一个下午（虽然才两三个小时），快速通关了，说实话其中有些关卡（后面几关以及复仇反击战）很有意思，可以说脑洞比较大，不过难度还行，就只有一个地方不知道是我的问题还是什么的，在第一个火箭筒那里那个管道怎么也上不去。最后用了几个硬盘一样的东西叠起来才过（这也行orz）。总的来说这游戏很好玩，玩过了和做了一套理综卷一样充实满足。对对对！最后通关了还有一首歌，未知女声留给你的，请签收（第一次看到游戏通关了还有带歌词的歌好感动。）。最后最重要的，win10可玩，自带中文。

Portal stammt aus dem Jahr 2007 und hat ein Stück weit Videospielgeschichte geschrieben. 

Die Handlung umfasst etwa 4 Stunden Spielzeit, wobei der Spieler stets unterschiedliche Testkammern durchläuft und deren Rätsel löst. Ab einem bestimmten Punkt gelangt man hinter die Kulissen des fiktiven Unternehmens "Aperture Science", wodurch Hilfestellungen des Supercomputers GlaDos nicht mehr gewährleistet werden. Viel mehr wird dieser den Spieler dazu bewegen wollen, umzukehren. 

Soweit zur Handlung. Gameplaytechnisch spielt sich Portal sehr differenziert im Gegensatz zu anderen Spielen. Die Physikrätsel sind gut durchdacht, ihre Schwierigkeit lässt jedoch gegen Ende des Spiels nach. 

 Die Grafik kann als durchschnittlich bezeichnet werden, herausragende Lichtefeffekte gab es selten, schönes Wasser und schöne Flammen nie zu sehen.

Portal takes physics, and puzzles and mixes them together in a way never seen before that just, works. With challenging puzzles, an intricate storyline, and a lovely antagonist Portal is definitely worth picking up.

glaDos Sweet GlaDos what have they put you through, huh?

Portal is a very puzzling game that really streatches your brain (which is why i wanted to beat it) 
But one thing that really sorta always had me woundering when watching videos about portal, was...
The cake is a lie...What does this mean? 
Does GlaDos like cake? 

Well thats for you to find out, but i did enjoy the hole story of this game and when the ending came i will admit i was a bit disappointed, 
So i quickly jumped into portal 2 and well, it ties so much things together (if) your a portal fan you will want the second game..just trust me. 

Bottom Line: Is this game Recommendable?! 
YES - you will find the puzzles challenging and the story mode, very intruiging, as Valve does well.
